INSIDE THE FACEBOOK HILL BRIEFINGS — Facebook’s Cambridge Analytica briefings on the Hill have centered heavily on content that’s already been shared in the company’s public blog posts, leaving many questions about the scope of the problem unanswered, according to Congressional aides familiar with the meetings.

ROSENWORCEL TAKES ON FCC SECURITY — FCC security officials had surrounded a woman in the audience of the agency’s meeting Thursday and were removing chairs from around her when Democratic Commissioner Jessica Rosenworcel stopped her statement opposing the 5G infrastructure order to intervene.

MATSUI PREPARING ‘SPECTRUM NOW ACT’ — Rep. Doris Matsui (D-Calif.) is putting together legislation to ensure federal agencies can use cash from the 14-year-old Spectrum Relocation Fund to properly research what government-held spectrum might be freed up or shared with commercial entities.

The omnibus contains several measures for techies to watch, including $600 million in dedicated spending for a rural broadband pilot program, FCC reauthorization and a bill that would govern law enforcement access of data that’s stored overseas, called the CLOUD Act (S. 2383 (115)).
